texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to read a book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are there any in the recreation room? I saw a bunch of picture books.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There may be some in the facility's library. I will fetch some.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Would you like her to do that?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I need an author and title.
Izumo doesn't bring us one of the slim pocket books that appeared in my dreams.
Instead, she returns with a complete compilation of Ryunosuke Akutagawa's works, one of which is Rashomon.
The book is as heavy as a portable computer.
Yonagi opens it on her lap and reads slowly.
I watch Yonagi as she reads.
Her gaze silently glides over the sea of small letters printed across the pages of the large book.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I like talking with you too.
Yonagi doesn't take her eyes off the thick tome as she speaks.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It looks like a difficult book. You can read it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's fun to just go word by word.
Yonagi nods and raises her face.
I sit next to her and follow the sentences together with her.
The paper has a yellow tint to it, and the text is dotted with characters I don't recognize.
It's immediately apparent that this is a really old book.
I take a glance at her profile.
She's zealously going word by word, even if she doesn't understand them all.
I follow her example and let my eyes take in the words weaved by a man named Ryunosuke Akutagawa.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you wanna go eat something?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to see a play.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not expecting a positive answer, but I gotta askâ€”

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You can watch videos from the archive.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Does that sound good to you?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There are some tablets you can use in the recreation room. Come this way.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: What play do you want to see?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A Midsummer's Night's Dream. From Shakespeare.
Izumo hands us a tablet device, and its screen displays people wearing clothes I've never seen before acting out a play.
Maybe my memory is just busted. Maybe the people of this city wear stuff like this.
No, just from looking at Izumo's attire and this whole facility's design, I can tell that this video was recorded in a completely different time period.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This actor is good. That actor is bad.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can tell? I think they're speaking in French or something.
I remember Olivia's demanding standards from the dream.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This actor is trying too hard. This one isn't trying at all.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to act in a play.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I like being someone I'm not.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But the times I can be myself are more precious.
I think on her words for a moment.
The times she can be herself?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Heheh, it's Puck. The troublemaker one.
I peer down at the screen in her hands.
The closing of the curtain signals a scene change.
Eventually, the pair of men and women wander into the forest and start arguing with each other.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The world did change. I'm happy.
Yonagi has a sweet smile on her face as she watches.
After looking at her placid expression for a moment, I turn to watch the play together with her.
She mutters, in the middle of third act.
I raise my face and look at Izumo.
She nods in response and quickly heads out of the recreation room.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There is one ready for use in the recreation room. It can take pictures.
I turn from Izumo back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wanna go somewhere to take the pictures?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hmm, the only place where we can go outside would be...
Clasping the small digital camera, Yonagi rushes out onto the rooftop.
Yonagi points the camera at the round sky dome and presses the shutter.
She smiles proudly as she looks at the result displayed on the small screen.
She then points the camera at me and presses the button.
Then she shows me the picture on the camera's display.
She excitedly points the camera at Izumo next.
And right after that, she does the same for Wooleep.
She presents me with the camera.
Yonagi walks closer to the handrail and strikes a pose with a hand on her waist.
I hold out the camera to her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But you still have a long way to go.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's fine, don't worry. Take more, please?
After that, we keep taking pictures. The day goes by with literally all the pictures of Izumo featuring the same deadpan expression.
